newsitem.title: MONACO: MOTOR RACING-HERBERT FASTEST AS FRENTZEN CRASHES IN MONACO.
newsitem.headline: MOTOR RACING-HERBERT FASTEST AS FRENTZEN CRASHES IN MONACO.

text.p: Briton Johnny Herbert topped the times in a Formula One practice session for the first time on Thursday, outpacing double world champion Michael Schumacher of Germany ahead of Sunday's Monaco Grand Prix.

The bubbly and popular Herbert, driving a Sauber car powered by a Petronas-badged Ferrari engine, was just one-tenth of a second faster than Schumacher, in a Ferrari, on a day when Heinz-Harald Frentzen's hopes were ended by a crash.
Frentzen, the German winner of the San Marino Grand Prix at Imola two weeks ago, suffered the indignity of crashing against the tight railings of the famous Mediterranean street circuit.
He lost control of his Williams, his car plunging into the steelwork which lines the full length of the track around the harbour. He was not hurt.

Herbert clocked a best time of one minute and 21.188 seconds to ease clear of Schumacher with Canadian world championship leader Jacques Villeneuve third in a Williams. Italian newcomer Giancarlo Fisichella was fourth in a Jordan.

Herbert, fourth in Monaco in 1995, third last year and hoping to do even better this year, said: "It is very nice for me to finish in this position today. But it is only practice and Saturday's qualifying session is the one that counts.
"We did a lot of work on the set-up of the car in testing at Barcelona last week and that is paying off for us now. I think there is more to come from the car, but I am sure everyone is saying that."
Herbert, who lives in Monaco, said he realised he had gone quickest only by seeing it on a giant screen above the circuit as he drove up the hill towards Casino Square.
"It was a good moment for me and I hope I can have another one like that on Saturday. That is what I want more than anything."
Herbert's success for Sauber emphasised how competitive the field is this season for the 55th running of the Monaco Grand Prix.
Schumacher said: "Qualifying will be very close on Saturday. You only have to lose a little time in one section and you can slip out of the top 10 here this year."
